posts.name: Elaine
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.61 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • It’s always OK to change your mind, so we fixed a bug that caused the image picker to open after pasting an attachment into a chat and then deciding not to send it.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.60 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.61.0.800-beta

52 new commits since 7.60.0.795-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.61 [1]

  • Add device transfer to QuickRestore flow [2]

  • Require PreKeyBundles to always contain Kyber keys [3]

  • Distinguish ACI and PNI-destined incoming messages [4]

  • Use the GroupIdentifier type in another place [5]

  • Handle edited group messages via group processor [6]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.72.1 [7]

  • Don’t re-parse proto when enqueuing group messages [8]

  • Update svr enclave [9]

  • Make DeletedCallRecordCleanupManager async [10]

  • Properly constrain too-large view-once videos to screen bounds [11]

  • Run the blocking TSAttachment migration on app launch [12]

  • Update registration asset [13]

  • Asyncify username deletion [14]

  • Avoid enqueuing multiple donation-redemption jobs for a single period [15]

  • Move AEP/registrationMessage to inMemoryState [16]

  • Move “wait for side effects” logic to shared type [17]

  • Remove unused GroupsV2Error cases [18]

  • Use a function, not nested type, for BackupSettings LoadedView [19]

  • Add identity keys to registration message [20]

  • Set the correct order of operations for backup restore after registration [21]

  • Move Backups views to top-level Signal target [22]

  • Hide upcoming call links when searching [23]

  • Track last viewed fullscreen time for attachments [24]

  • Wait for processing for low-priority pushes [25]

  • Only export BackupLocator if feature flag enabled [26]

  • Wait for app ready when processing notifications [27]

  • Add building image [28]

  • Fix group invites [29]

  • Tweak voice message filename to match other platforms [30]

  • Enqueue media tier downloads for all attachments when disabling optimize media [31]

  • Add method to cancel pending media tier downloads when enabling optimize media [32]

  • Add method to schedule all backup attachment uploads when enabling paid backups [33]

  • Clean up + prepare some shouldOptimizeLocalStorage code [34]

  • Treat incoming messages in note to self as always being from self in backup export [35]

  • Fix string oopsie [36]

  • Implement AttachmentOffloadingManager [37]

  • Update quick restore transfer UI [38]

  • Asyncify forwarding & fix bug [39]

  • Consolidate search code to fix bug [40]

  • Asyncify search flows [41]

  • Asyncify maximumPaymentAmount and related code [42]

  • Use BackgroundMessageFetcher in the main app [43]

  • Replace StaleBot config with actions/stale workflow [44]

  • Remove GroupsV2OutgoingChanges protocol [45]

  • Update libsignal to 0.73.1 [46]

  • Consolidate PKC fetches when creating groups [47]

  • Enforce non-empty group titles via the compiler [48]

  • Require GroupSecretParams for group builders [49]

  • Remove unused code [50]

  • Update release notes [51]

  • Update translations [52]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.60.0.795-beta…7.61.0.800-beta

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked:
So many crashes on both my iPad and my iPhone, have been submitting crash logs.
Edit: was using an older beta, will report back after updating
Edit2: Crashing when clicking camera button on latest testflight

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Hello!

This issue still happen: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.60 release - #9 by fr33tux

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.60 release

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Hi, sorry that’s still happening. Could I ask you to get debug logs from the latest build, so we can take a look?

Additionally, can you confirm the steps they’re taking that cause the crash?

  1. Receive multiple images/videos.
  2. Use the “save” option from the long-press context menu.
  3. App crash

Does it only happen to them with multiple media?

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Sorry about the noisy crashes. There was an issue that was causing background crashes at higher rates – those background-crash prompts are only visible to beta users, but they do get noisy. That issue should be addressed!

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: It’s not just in the background. Consistently whenever I click the camera button when texting someone, or when trying to take a photo for stories, the app crashes. I’ve been forced to just take the photo externally and send it as a photo. Happens on latest beta

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
No worries, it happens

The crash happens when they try to save a photo from a gallery of received messages. It crashes when saving the first time (it can be the first photo in the list, or any of them - it simply crashes on the first time they save).

The steps:

  1. Received multiple photos in a message
  2. Open the gallery view to browse through those received pictures, and swipe through them
  3. Save a picture - crash.
  4. Open Signal, do the same steps, and no further crashes until another message with multiple photos come in.

I hope to get the more recent debug logfile, I’ll keep you posted.

Thank you!
Hiding the screen in the split screen doesn’t work reliably…

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Sorry to hear that. Could I ask you to submit debug logs, and ideally also a .ips crash report, the next time it happens? There may be a lot of IPS crash reports on your device, so the most-recent one right after a crash would be most helpful.

posts.name: Fabian
posts.cooked: Can confirm, that’s also happening in the live version

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: Seems that this is caused by an iOS update (in my case 18.5) where the back camera becomes unavailable. I have reported it to Apple and restarted, which seems to have at least temporarily fixed it. The cause of the crash seems to be the unavailable camera, which would be nice if the app could force the front camera or show a black screen as does the iOS camera app, at least instead of crashing.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Interesting, thanks for following up! Agreed that crashing is a bad failure mode – we’ll track this internally.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Thanks for those details. Would you be able to get an .ips crash report, as described here? We can symbolicate those, and they can tell us more about what exactly is crashing.

I’m able to reproduce some issues with the media viewer, though. We’ll take a look.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: (I’m also curious: does this issue happen when the media in the received album might still be downloading? We’re aware of an issue that can cause a transient crash in the media viewer related to attachments downloading.)

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Hello!

I just sent you a .ips in DM.

The issue can indeed happen when the album is being downloaded, although it’s sometimes fully downloaded already (or at least looks like so).

Thank you for your support!

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.62 release.
